videos.title: How To Draw A Farm Landscape
videos.description:
In this art lesson, Jack and I are learning how to draw a farm landscape! We hope you and your kids have a lot of fun following along with us. 
Art Supplies ~ This is a list of the supplies we used, but feel free to use whatever you have in your home or classroom.
~Sharpie (or something to draw with)
~Paper (we use marker paper)
~Markers to color with (we use Bianyo)
~Colored pencils (sometimes we also use Prismacolor colored pencils)

Hey, guys! 👋 It's Rob from Art For Kids Hub. Today, we're going to learn how to draw a Celtic knot 🧑🎨🎨. Celtic knots are a type of intricate pattern that was commonly used in ancient Ireland and Scotland 🏰🍀. But don't worry, you don't need to be a history buff to draw this! We'll take it step-by-step, and by the end, you'll have your very own beautiful Celtic knot drawing 🤩✏️. So grab a pencil, marker, and some paper, and let's get started! 📝👨👩👧👦
Art Supplies ~ This is a list of the supplies we used, but feel free to use whatever you have in your home or classroom.
~Pencil and erasure
~Black marker (or something to draw with)
~Paper (we use marker paper)
~Markers to color with. We use our Art For Kids Hub markers. You can purchase them here https://shop.artforkidshub.com/products/art-for-kids-hub-80-piece-alcohol-based-marker-set
~Colored pencils (sometimes we also use Prismacolor colored pencils)
Visit our art supply page for more information about the supplies used in this lesson.

videos.title: How To Draw The Entire Alphabet! ABC Drawings!
videos.description:
Hey there, friends! 🎨👋 It's Rob from Art For Kids Hub, and we're back with another fun and exciting drawing adventure for all you little artists, parents, and teachers out there! 😄👩👧👦👩🏫
Today, we're diving into the world of letters with our video, "How To Draw The Entire Alphabet!" That's right, we'll not only learn how to write each letter, but we'll also transform them into something super cool that starts with that very letter! ✏️🔄🦩
For example, we'll kick things off with the letter A, and then, before you know it, we'll turn it into a snappy alligator! 🐊🤯 How awesome is that? 😁
So grab your pencils, crayons, or markers, and let's get ready to have a blast while learning the alphabet and creating some fantastic drawings together! ✍️🎉
Remember, whether you're a kiddo, parent, or teacher, this video is perfect for all skill levels and ages. So come on, let's make some alphabetic magic happen! 🌟🎨🔠

videos.title: How To Draw A Funny Yogurt Parfait
videos.description:
Hey everyone, it's Rob from Art For Kids Hub, and today we have a special treat for you! I'm joined by my lovely wife, Teryn, for an exciting and funny art lesson on how to draw a silly yogurt parfait. You'll love our step-by-step guide that makes drawing simple and fun for kids, parents, and teachers alike. So grab your art supplies, and let's get started!

In this lesson, we'll take you through the process of creating a funny yogurt parfait character, complete with a big smile, silly eyes, and loads of tasty toppings. You'll learn how to draw a parfait glass, layer your yogurt and fruit, and add in all the funny details that will make your creation truly unique. This is a perfect activity to enjoy together as a family, and you can even challenge each other to see who can come up with the silliest yogurt parfait character!

As always, we encourage you to get creative and use your imagination! Feel free to add your favorite toppings, swap out the fruit, or even give your yogurt parfait a fun background setting. The sky's the limit, and we can't wait to see what you come up with.

Don't forget to share your artwork with us by tagging us on social media or using the hashtag #ArtForKidsHub. We absolutely love seeing your and your kid's creations and might even reshare your funny yogurt parfait on social media. So join Teryn and me for a fun drawing adventure, and let's make some hilarious yogurt parfaits together!

Happy drawing, and remember, the most important thing is to have fun and practice!

~Black marker (or something to draw with)

Hey, art friends! Today, Jack and I are already getting into the Halloween spirit by learning how to draw a Jolly Roger Pirate Flag together. This lesson uses a lot of black marker ink, but don't worry, we've got some cool tips to conserve ink. You can either 1. use a white colored pencil with black paper or 2. use a black marker on white paper and cut out the skull and crossbones to paste on black paper. 
Grab your art supplies, and let's make something super spooky! ❤️💛💙

videos.title: How To Draw Happy New Year - Using Alcohol-Based Markers!
videos.description:
Hey, art friends! 🎨 Get ready for some New Year's fun with me and Austin as we show you how to draw "Happy New Year" in vibrant bubble letters! 🎊 But that's not all - we're also sharing some cool tips on using our amazing alcohol-based Art For Kids Hub markers to bring your artwork to life! ✨ Whether you're an art pro or just starting out, this video is perfect for all artists. Grab your markers, and let's create some New Year's art together!

Materials:
Pencil ✏️
Eraser 🧹
Marker Paper 📄
Art For Kids Hub Markers 🖍️

Fun Fact:
Did you know that the tradition of celebrating the New Year dates back over 4,000 years to ancient Babylon? They were the first to hold recorded celebrations in honor of the new year, but they didn't start in January like we do today! 📆🌟

How To Draw An Atom
videos.description:
Join Teryn and me in this educational art lesson, where we'll teach you how to draw a basic atom. Perfect for young learners and aspiring artists, this simple tutorial uses Art For Kids Hub markers and marker paper. You'll not only create a visual representation of an atom but also have the option to label its parts for a better understanding of its structure. Let's dive into this art and science project!

Materials:
Art For Kids Hub markers 🖍️
Marker paper 📄

Fun Fact:
Did you know that atoms are so small that millions of them would fit on the head of a pin? Yet, they make up everything we see, touch, and interact with in our daily lives. That's the amazing world of atoms for you! 🌍✨

Let’s have some fun and explore how simple it is to draw this cool robot using just markers and paper. Remember, you don't have to use the same supplies. videos.title: How to Draw Blue from the movie IF
videos.description:
Hey there, art friends! 🎨 This amazing adventure is sponsored by Paramount Pictures! In today's super cool art lesson, we're learning how to draw Blue from IF. It's going to be awesome! 🌟
Ready for even more fun? Parents, click this link to purchase on digital: https://paramnt.us/IF_AFKH.
Plus, after drawing Blue, head over to https://IFgenerator.com to create your own IFs and let your imagination go!
"IF" is about a girl named Bea who can see everyone's imaginary friends or IFs. Join Bea and Ryan's character, Cal, on a magical adventure to reconnect forgotten IFs with their kids. It's sure to be a good time with lots of laughs, especially with a cast that includes Ryan Reynolds!
And let's not forget our main IF, Blue, played by Steve Carell. Blue is a purple IF who loves croissants! 
Don't miss "IF," only in theaters on May 17th. Tickets are available now! 🎬

IF is a movie about imaginary friends that both kids and parents will love, making it perfect for your next family movie night. Don't forget to share your amazing Blossom drawings with the hashtag #IFMovie!

videos.description:

In this lesson, we'll:
Draw with a black marker on marker paper.
Color using our markers.

Tip: Instead of using a black marker to color your black cat, use a dark grey. That way, the black marker lines for the face won't disappear!
So grab your art supplies, and let's have some creative fun together!

🥔🍀 How To Draw A Funny Leprechaun Potato! 🍀🥔 Hey art friends! Today, Hadley and I are drawing a funny and cute Irish potato dressed up as a leprechaun! 🥔😆🍀 This is such a fun lesson, perfect for kids of all ages!

We’ll start with a pencil to get our potato shape just right, then we’ll use our markers to add all the fun details—like a leprechaun hat, a jacket, and bowtie! 🌈💰✨

🖍️ Art Supplies Needed:
Pencil ✏️ (for sketching the potato shape)
Markers
Marker paper
(But feel free to use whatever you have!)
